meanings.definition: To form crystals again from a solution.
meanings.sent1: After heating the liquid, the sugar began to recrystallize into beautiful shapes.
meanings.sent2: When the water cooled down, the salt started to recrystallize at the bottom of the container.
meanings.sent3: The magical potion would only recrystallize under the light of a full moon.
meanings.sent4: Her memories seemed to recrystallize in her mind, becoming clearer with each passing day.
meanings.sent5: The process of recrystallize can be visually stunning, like watching a snowflake form under a microscope.

meanings.definition: To form crystals again from a solid.
meanings.sent1: Over time, the metal statue began to recrystallize, creating a sparkling surface.
meanings.sent2: The rock that had melted in the sun started to recrystallize as the temperature dropped.
meanings.sent3: The chocolate bar left in the sun started to recrystallize, turning into a crunchy mess.
meanings.sent4: His ideas seemed to recrystallize in his mind, forming a clear plan of action.
meanings.sent5: The gemstone appeared to recrystallize before their eyes, transforming into a dazzling jewel.
